captions.text: My name is Travis Pastrana

This is my wife
[ MY WIFE ]
This is where I'm going
[ MY TEAM ]
And this is my story
[On Pace with Pastrana, Season 2]

Last year we didn't really 
know what to expect,
and I was pretty excited

I started out, we were 
20th to 25th place

Out there it's mid pack
in the nationwide series
[cheers]

-Where did we end up?
-[unintelligible]
But as it started progressing
I found that I would do my best
when I had back-to-back races,
and then we'd have an off season
I'd go do the trucks, or do the GRC
- You gotta be kidding me!
And I'd come back, and
I felt like I was starting at square one,
I just didn't have the experience
that the other guys did, and I

didn't retain a lot of the stuff
that I wanted to,

just because it was a couple
weeks off, when

they had more time to test,
more time to practice

And the fact that I didn't 
have a teammate

For me, someone that doesn't 
know how to set up the car

When we talk wedge and 
he talks wedge

he's jumping over something
with a wedge, and

we're talking about just trying
to get our racecars to turn
I would tell you, Harry,
but I don't know anything about cars
I had Matt Crafton as a driver coach

jump in my car, and take up
my practice time, when

I didn't really know a lot about how 
to drive these courses
[ laughter ]

Do you ever feel it, when you're
getting in the corner, kind of...
[ thud, thud, thud ]

...doing one of those?
-Yeah

-Did you feel that?
-Yeah
- Tell him that
But it was so crucial for me
to have that person to go out there
and kind of set the car up
Now, I'm on Roush Fenway Racing.
[ ROUSH FENWAY ]

What's really awesome 
coming into this year is

I know we're going to 
have a strong car
Let's go with Roush Fenway,
let's go with a solid team

I've got Trevor Bain, I've got
Carl Edwards,

Greg Biffle and
Ricky Stenhouse, Jr.
as teammates, as mentors

These guys have been doing it
their whole lives, you know

I want to win. 
I want to do better.
I want to learn

and so to have this many 
guys around me,

and to have the camraderie 
and all this information,

is going to be such a 
huge advantage

NASCAR's all about just 
being really smooth
GRC is all about agression,

just wide open, slamming 
on the brakes,

throwing the wheel, oversteer,
all-wheel drive

It's very different to approach 
these races
What's fun this year is the

GRC is going global, with
Global X Games

So when we go down to Brazil, 
we go over to Spain,

we're actually going to
have some dirt
and we're going to continue this
deal with Bryce Menzies,

with Dodge starting and being
a team owner is just...
it's exciting
Being on a NASCAR team isn't like

being on a freestyle or 
motocross, or even GRC

There are 200 employees
at Raush Fenway that

are affected if I get hurt, if I 
can't make it to the race

And this is a really tough 
thing to deal with,

because I enjoy to 
have a lot of fun

I like to, just kind of, on 
a wing and a prayer,
Let's go do this
- I married an idiot!

Leg gets surgery tomorrow, so I figure
how hurt can you get, right?
And it's taken me back a little bit

but you can't ever stop what
makes you who you are,

or I feel like you're going to 
slow down and you're not

going to be as good at the
other things you do, so,

for me, my life is about trying
to do the best that I can,
and if the best that I can
is by having fun,
by doing a few things that are
a little reckless, a little crazy,

then we're going to 
keep doing that

And after all this, the 
GRC, the NASCAR,
the motorcycles, the craziness,
Lyndsey's pregnant
It's really hard to think now
on how the baby's going to change
how I'm going to be

Watching some of my friends
that had kids, and

some of the guys that were even 
so tough, and they thought,

"Oh, I wanted a boy," or this
and that, and then they

had a little girl, and they just 
completely melted, even if

they had a boy, and I still want
to be the person that I am

but I'm going to want to spend 
more time at home

You know, our lives were so 
hectic and crazy before, and

we were pretty lucky that we always
got to travel, together, a lot

and so I definitely had to put
my career on hold
There was a lot coming up

with the expansion of X games, 
and things like that, and so
it's a little bit boring being pregnant,

not being able to do all 
the fun activities, but

as soon as she gets here, 
and I get back in shape,
I'll be back on my board, and
I don't think things will be too different
I just couldn't imagine

living this kind of life without 
Travis with me, it's just
I don't know what I did before him
I want to spend as much time as possible

with my wife, and when 
this little girl comes out

I want to spend as much time 
as I can with her
And that's going to be really tough
with the demands of the job, but
we're going to make it happen

I definitely have focusses going in
a lot of different directions,

but I figure this is like a 
"perfect storm" for me
To do all that, have a happy life, and

hopefully win some doggone races
in NASCAR and GRC

On the next episode of 
"On Pace with Pastrana"
we're about to head over to Barcelona,
hang out with all my friends,
and race some GRC

title: On Pace w/ Pastrana - SEASON PREMIERE - Switching Gears

I'm Sorry but, I've been racing dirt bikes all my life. I'm sort of tough, 
I've gone through the pain but this isn't about me. Ever since i was a 
little guy on a pw-50 I was looking up to this guy. The crazy stuff he's 
done in life... And you know to see what he's doing right now... That's my 
dream. I want my life to be crazy, hectic and involving fast things (cars 
and bikes) But when I see him put aside everything he's done in life for 
his wife and kid, It's just awe-inspiring.
